title: Business & Finance
text:
Stocks fell in a volatile session, dragged down by news that the Omicron variant was detected in the U.S. The S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq lost 1.2%, 1.3% and 1.8%, respectively.

---

MLB team owners and the players' union ended talks Wednesday without reaching a new collective bargaining agreement, setting the stage for a possible lockout.

---

Americans are applying for credit cards at a rate not seen since before the pandemic, according to recent data from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York .

---

Exxon Mobil said it would maintain a conservative budget for the next five years, as the outlook for oil and gas demand remains murky.

---

Square, the financial-services company co-founded and led by former Twitter chief Dorsey, is changing its corporate name to Block.

---

WeWork said in a securities filing it would restate several quarters of its results and that management has concluded there was a material weakness in its internal control.

---

Disney 's board elected Susan Arnold as its new chairman, succeeding Robert Iger , who is set to depart later this month.

---

Macau's casinos have shut down the VIP rooms of the gambling hub's largest junket operator.
